summary: I've just finished watching Bad Samaritan and I'm literally shocked. This film is very thrilling and David Tennant is creepy as...
body: I’ve just finished watching Bad Samaritan and I’m literally shocked. This film is very thrilling and David Tennant is creepy as hell. Even though I have to admit he is very good at playing the role of the bad guy.

tags: between steven moffat and RTD and david
I do think it's the super-clever-ness that always appealed to me the most
summary: Behind the Scenes of Silence in the Library/Forest of the Dead (Part Six) Excerpt from the Forrest of the Dead podcast...
caption:
Behind the Scenes of Silence in the Library/Forest of the Dead (Part Six)

Excerpt from the Forrest of the Dead podcast commentary featuring David Tennant, Russell T. Davies, and Steven Moffat (discussing the scene where River whispers into the Doctor’s ear):

Steven Moffat: I have to say, David, just to butter you up as it were, I think your performance in this is astonishing. The two bits that are brilliant are… is this - where you’re just flung back to being a man - just an ordinary bloke for a minute - and this bit…
RTD: Yes, this bit!
SM: …where you shoulder the Doctor again.  There we are!
RTD: Mask back on
David Tennant: [ laughing ]
RTD: You see how much the Doctor is… surface
SM: Yeah.  That’s the interesting thing about the Doctor, isn’t it?  What is it that’s special about him?  In terms of writing him - he’s not faster or stronger, actually.  He can regenerate which is pretty cool but not all the time, you know. He’s super clever, but actually the people he’s up against are super clever so it’s not that.   I think he’s just got this… it’s almost the power of the greatest gob in the universe
RTD: Yes
SM: He can sort of talk his way, confidently, past anybody
DT: Which he slightly abuses there, because he’s been slightly undermined…
SM:  Oh yeah
DT: …he shouts too loudly and he’s a bit nasty to O.T. [O.T. Fagbenle played “Other Dave”]
SM: Yes but look - they’re all confident in him now
DT: Yeah
SM: He’s a bit mean.  A little bit of him is kind of, almost a charlatan - in a good cause
RTD: Yes
SM: He poses, doesn’t he?  He makes it seem like he’s this godlike creature, and kind of, really there’s just a bloke under there.
RTD: Oh, he’s not, absolutely
SM: …which I think makes him great fun to write

Other parts of this photoset:  [ one ] [ two ] [ three ] [ four ] [ five ] [seven]
[ List of all Doctor Who Behind the Scenes photosets ]

summary: What Was David Tennant Doing When He Was Asked to be the Tenth Doctor?
title: What Was David Tennant Doing When He Was Asked to be the Tenth Doctor?
body:
What Was David Tennant Doing When He Was Asked to be the Tenth Doctor?

David Tennant has revealed what he was doing when he was asked to play the Tenth Doctor – and it turns out, Russell T. Davies approached him for the role in a very personal way.

Because the pair had worked together on Casanova, and Davies knew what a big fan of Doctor Who Tennant is, he afforded him a glimpse at Ninth Doctor, Christopher Eccleston in action. David said:

“I was in Russell T.…

View On WordPress

blog.name: super-hero-confessions
blog.title: Super-Hero-Confessions
blog.description:
Super-hero-confessions is a blog where you can submit your confessions/personal opinions about any of the super hero movies, comics, television shows, cartoons, etc.

The confessions that are posted are those that are submitted; not the opinions of the blog owners. All the confessions will be anonymous when posted. Feel free to submit photos along with your confession if you would like as well.

If you want us to see a post tag it with either #superheroconfessions or #superhero confessions

blog.name: davidtennantfanboy
blog.title: No one's ever going to forget you
blog.description:
"No one's ever going to forget you."

Sideblog dedicated to David Tennant's Doctor, the one, the only, and the best.

my edits・my gifs
meeting david
main blog

tags: i still can't believe i've met david again for a second time
it all happend so fast and unexpectedly
when i met him last year at don juan in soho stage door i thought it'd be a one-in-a-lifetime opportunity
never dreamt of this happening again
yet when i heard they announcing a new big guest during lfcc day 2 i immediately knew it was him
i was queuing for pearl mackie's autograph and when i hear his name from the speakers my heart stopped
i was so happy yet so stressed
what followed was a two hour queue at the sales desk to try and get the best tickets i could
then massive chaos and fights with the staff at the photo shoots and more queues
but it was so worth it to just catch another little glimpse of david
during my second photo i was so blessed to witness david doing a little dance between photos
really happy with how my photos turned out as well
i had a blast and cannot wait for when i'll meet david a 3rd time
always my doctor and favourite actor
also apologies for not being very active here but i'm always back when something important like this happens
even though it isn't theatre because i want this post to appear in my 'meeting david' page
